title: Superannuation (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 30 of 2024)) of the
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Local Government Act 2001
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Local Government Act 2001 

(Retirement of Firefighters) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 19 August 2024.

title: Superannuation (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 30 of 2024)) of the
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations— 

“firefighter” means— 

(a) 

a full-time employee of a fire authority whose duties 
include attendance at fires, or 

(b) 

a retained firefighter; 

“fire authority” has the meaning assigned to it by section 9 of the Fire 
Services Act 1981 (No. 30 of 1981); 

“medically fit” in respect of a firefighter, means a medical examination 
arranged or approved of by the fire authority employing or engaging the 
firefighter and undergone by the firefighter, as deemed appropriate by 
the fire authority, before the start of the year in respect of each year he or 
she wishes to serve beyond that age; 

“retained firefighter” means a person, who is not a full-time employee of 
a fire authority, retained by the fire authority to attend at an incident if 
alerted and is paid a retainer for his or her availability.

title: Superannuation (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 (No. 30 of 2024)) of the
heading: 3. (1) Subject to Regulation 4, a firefighter shall retire—
text_raw:
3. (1) Subject to Regulation 4, a firefighter shall retire— 

(a) 

upon attaining age of 55 years, or 

(b) where the firefighter wishes to serve beyond that age and 
the fire authority who employs him or her is satisfied that 
he or she is medically fit to continue to serve as a firefighter 
upon attaining that age but not beyond attaining the age of 
62 years. 

(2) Where a firefighter is declared under paragraph (1)(b) not to be medically 

fit to continue to serve as a firefighter, he or she shall retire. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 30th August, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4. These Regulations do not apply to firefighters whose existing terms and 
conditions of service provide for a minimum retirement age in excess of 65 years 
or a mandatory retirement age in excess of 62 years.

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform consents to the making of the forgoing Regulations.

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

This Regulation provides for the retirement of firefighters (fulltime and retained) 
at age 55, but allows firefighters who are medically fit to continue to serve as 
firefighters up to age 62.
